definition: (of mist, snow, floodwater etc) a vast expanse of whiteness

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
vast, with no clear boundary/fig. hazy/indistinct/unclear/confused
vast, with no clear boundary/fig. hazy/indistinct/unclear/confused

sentences.english: He overlooked the land, which was still a vast expanse of whiteness.
sentences.chinese: 他忽略了土地，这仍然是一个白茫茫。

sentences.english: Afar, it offered a pale blank of mist and cloud;
sentences.chinese: 远处，呈现的是一片白茫茫的云雾。

sentences.english: The camels rolled in the white dust, raising puffs of cloud.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼在白茫茫的沙里打滚，扬起阵阵尘雾。

sentences.english: Was a vast expanse of whiteness as PianPianRan didn't know so.
sentences.chinese: 白茫茫一片，就像翩翩然不知所以。

sentences.english: The winter storm has whited out the highway here.
sentences.chinese: 冬天的暴风雪使人无法看清此地白茫茫的公路。

sentences.english: Looked from the window Yeah, white vast expanse of whiteness, and there is fog on Lake Ming.
sentences.chinese: 从窗户望去呀，白白茫茫的，有鸣潭上都是雾。

sentences.english: The fields covered with snow became a vast expanse of whiteness stretching to infinity.
sentences.chinese: 田野被大雪覆盖，白茫茫的一眼望不到边。

sentences.english: When it snows, the ground is all white.
sentences.chinese: 当下雪时，地面白茫茫的一片。

sentences.english: It was a total whiteout, says Jennifer.
sentences.chinese: “表面完全白茫茫一片”，詹妮弗说。

sentences.english: I had tubes down my throat, and everything was white.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉喉咙里插着管子，周围一切都是白茫茫的。

sentences.english: Get off a home, in a failed everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 到家下车一看，到处都是白茫茫的一片。

sentences.english: Bill staggered on through the milky water.
sentences.chinese: 比尔在白茫茫的河水里一摇一晃地走着。

sentences.english: "It was a total whiteout, " says Jennifer.
sentences.chinese: “外面完全白茫茫一片”，詹妮弗说。

definition: goose feather snow (idiom)/big heavy snow fall
brilliant white snow cover (esp. of distant peaks)
as far as the eye can see (idiom)
to stretch as far as the eye can see (idiom)
(of snow etc) to fill the sky
